definition: (coll.) nowadays
this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)
grain/harvest (old)/variant of 年[nian2]
surname Nian
year/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: These days, a unit test can mean anything.
sentences.chinese: 这年头，单元测试能代表一切。

sentences.english: There are always records. Everyone has records these days.
sentences.chinese: 这肯定有档案，这年头每个人都该有档案的。

sentences.english: B： Criminals are really sneaky these days.
sentences.chinese: 这年头的罪犯还真是狡猾。

sentences.english: Supporting a family is becoming more and more difficult these days.
sentences.chinese: 这年头要扶养一个家庭越来越不容易了。

sentences.english: In these years, there were too many scammers.
sentences.chinese: 这年头，各色骗子太多了。

sentences.english: Those vamps got hijacked by a lot of soft-focus romance.
sentences.chinese: 这年头那些吸血鬼啊，都被柔和的爱情小说给劫持了。

sentences.english: Chickens were beginning to sound like the ideal pet.
sentences.chinese: 这年头，鸡正开始显得像人们理想的崇物了。

sentences.english: Who has only one e-mail address these days?
sentences.chinese: 这年头谁还只有一个电子邮箱地址呢？

sentences.english: One must be so careful these days.
sentences.chinese: 这年头人得万事小心呵。

sentences.english: You must go into trade if you want to make money nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 这年头要想弄钱，得去做生意。

sentences.english: I think pop music is too cheezy nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得这年头流行音乐太多了。

definition: public morals are degenerating with each passing day (idiom)
the ways of the world/the morals of the time
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)

let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
alas/oh dear
interjection or grunt of agreement or recognition (e.g. yes, it's me!)/to sigh
to talk nonsense
the men of today are sadly degenerated (idiom)
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
battle cry
well-off/wealthy
erhua variant of 哥們|哥们[ge1 men5]
of little value
(interj. of admiration or of disgust)/to click one's tongue/to attempt to (find an opportunity to) speak

(old) unprincipled/incorrect/(modern) unnatural/against reason/incredible
Nyima county, Tibetan: Nyi ma rdzong in Nagchu prefecture 那曲地區|那曲地区[Na4 qu3 di4 qu1], central Tibet
